# 探索性数据分析7 {#eda07}


今天讲一个关于企鹅的数据故事。数据来源[这里](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-07-28/penguins.csv)，图片来源[这里](https://github.com/allisonhorst/palmerpenguins). 

```{r out.width = '100%', echo = FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics("images/penguins.png")
```



## 数据

### 导入数据
读取本地`penguins.csv`文件，也可以通过宏包`palmerpenguins::penguins`获取数据
```{r eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
d <- palmerpenguins::penguins
d %>%
  tidyr::drop_na() %>%
  head()
```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
penguins <- read_csv("./demo_data/penguins.csv") %>%
  janitor::clean_names() # %>%
# na.omit()
penguins %>%
  head()
```
### 变量含义

|variable          |class   |description |
|:-----------------|:-------|:-----------|
|species           |integer | 企鹅种类 (Adelie, Gentoo, Chinstrap) |
|island            |integer | 所在岛屿 (Biscoe, Dream, Torgersen) |
|bill_length_mm    |double  | 嘴峰长度 (单位毫米) |
|bill_depth_mm     |double  | 嘴峰深度 (单位毫米)|
|flipper_length_mm |integer | 鰭肢长度 (单位毫米) |
|body_mass_g       |integer | 体重 (单位克) |
|sex               |integer | 性别 |
|year              |integer | 记录年份 |



The main measurements are body mass, culmen (bill) length, bill depth, and flipper length.
作者的意图是取代iris

```{r out.width = '86%', echo = FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics("images/culmen_depth.png")
```



## 探索性分析

### 数据清洗
```{r}
penguins %>% filter_all(
  any_vars(is.na(.))
)
```
发现有11行或多或少的有缺失值，于是我们就删除它们



```{r}
penguins <- penguins %>% drop_na()
penguins
```

### 每种类型企鹅有多少只
```{r}
penguins %>%
  count(species, sort = T)
```

```{r}
penguins %>%
  count(island, sort = T)
```


### 每种类型企鹅各种属性的均值
```{r}
penguins %>%
  group_by(species) %>%
  summarize(across(where(is.numeric), mean, na.rm = TRUE))
```



### 性别特征
```{r}
penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm)) +
  geom_histogram(aes(fill = sex)) +
  facet_wrap(vars(species), scales = "free")
```

来张更好看点的
```{r}
penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, fill = sex)) +
  geom_histogram(
    position = "identity",
    alpha = 0.7,
    bins = 25
  ) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#66b3ff", "#8c8c8c")) +
  ylab("number of penguins") +
  xlab("length (mm)") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    legend.position = "bottom",
    legend.text = element_text(size = 11),
    legend.title = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    axis.title = element_text(color = "white", size = 10),
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12, hjust = 1)
  ) +
  facet_wrap(vars(species), scales = "free")
```
同理可以画出其他属性的分布






### 每种类型企鹅各种嘴峰长度的分布
```{r}
penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm)) +
  geom_density() +
  facet_wrap(vars(species))
```



```{r}
library(ggridges)
penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, fill = species)) +
  ggridges::geom_density_ridges(aes(y = species))
```




同理，我们可以画出嘴峰深度的分布

```{r}
penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_depth_mm, fill = species)) +
  ggridges::geom_density_ridges(aes(y = species))
```
```{r}
penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_depth_mm, fill = sex)) +
  ggridges::geom_density_ridges(aes(y = species))
```
```{r}
penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = body_mass_g, fill = sex)) +
  ggridges::geom_density_ridges(aes(y = species), alpha = 0.5)
```


但，这样一个变量一个变量的画，可能会比较麻烦。于是我们可以这样
```{r}
penguins %>%
  select(species, bill_length_mm:body_mass_g) %>%
  pivot_longer(-species, names_to = "measurement", values_to = "value") %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = value)) +
  geom_density(aes(color = species, fill = species), size = 1.2, alpha = 0.2) +
  facet_wrap(vars(measurement), ncol = 2, scales = "free")
```

```{r}
penguins %>%
  select(species, bill_length_mm:body_mass_g) %>%
  pivot_longer(-species, names_to = "measurement", values_to = "value") %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = species, y = value)) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(color = species, fill = species), size = 1.2, alpha = 0.2) +
  facet_wrap(vars(measurement), ncol = 2, scales = "free")
```

### 嘴峰长度和深度的分布
```{r}
penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(
    x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm,
    shape = species, color = species
  )) +
  geom_point()
```

```{r}
penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(
    x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm,
    shape = species, color = species
  )) +
  geom_point(aes(size = body_mass_g))
```


感觉这是一个辛普森佯谬， 我们画图看看
```{r}
penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = species, shape = species)) +
  geom_smooth(method = lm) +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, aes(color = species))
```

penguins %>%

### 可视化学统计

这个[ggstatsplot](https://indrajeetpatil.github.io/ggstatsplot/)宏包将统计分析的结果写在图片里，统计结果和图形融合在一起，让统计结果更容易懂了。（科研数据可视化中会介绍）, 


```{r}
penguins %>%
  group_by(species) %>%
  summarise(
    count = n(),
    mean_body_mass = mean(body_mass_g),
    sd_body_mass = sd(body_mass_g)
  )
```

#### 参数检验
one-way ANOVA(要求等方差)

```{r}
stats::aov(formula = body_mass_g ~ species, data = penguins) %>%
  summary()
```



one-way ANOVA(不要求等方差)[here](http://www.sthda.com/english/wiki/one-way-anova-test-in-r)
```{r}
oneway.test(body_mass_g ~ species, data = penguins)
```

```{r}
stats::aov(formula = body_mass_g ~ species, data = penguins) %>%
  TukeyHSD(which = "species") %>%
  broom::tidy()
```


```{r}
library(ggstatsplot)

penguins %>%
  ggbetweenstats(
    x = species, # > 2 groups
    y = body_mass_g,
    type = "parametric",
    messages = FALSE,
    var.equal = FALSE
  )
```

#### 非参数检验
[here](http://www.sthda.com/english/wiki/kruskal-wallis-test-in-r)
```{r}
kruskal.test(body_mass_g ~ species, data = penguins)
```

```{r}
penguins %>%
ggbetweenstats(
  x = species, 
  y = body_mass_g,
  type = "nonparametric", 
  mean.ci = TRUE, 
  pairwise.comparisons = TRUE, # <<
  pairwise.display = "all", # ns = only non-significant
  p.adjust.method = "fdr", # <<
  messages = FALSE
)
```


### 嘴峰长度与嘴峰深度的比例
```{r}
penguins %>%
  mutate(ratio = bill_length_mm / bill_depth_mm) %>%
  group_by(species) %>%
  summarise(mean = mean(ratio))
```

```{r}
penguins %>%
  mutate(ratio = bill_length_mm / bill_depth_mm) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = ratio, fill = species)) +
  ggridges::geom_density_ridges(aes(y = species))
```


### 建立模型

```{r}
scale_fun <- function(x) {
  (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
}

d <- penguins %>%
  select(sex, species, bill_length_mm:body_mass_g) %>%
  mutate(
    across(where(is.numeric), scale_fun)
  ) %>%
  mutate(male = if_else(sex == "male", 1, 0))
d
```

按照species分组后，对flipper_length_mm标准化？这样数据会聚拢到一起了喔
```{r, eval=FALSE}
penguins %>%
  select(sex, species, bill_length_mm:body_mass_g) %>%
  group_by(species) %>%
  mutate(
    across(where(is.numeric), scale_fun)
  ) %>%
  ungroup()
```



#### model_01
```{r}
logit_mod1 <- glm(
  male ~ 1 + species + bill_length_mm + bill_depth_mm +
    flipper_length_mm + body_mass_g,
  data = d,
  family = binomial(link = "logit")
)

summary(logit_mod1)
```


```{r}
library(ggeffects)
ggpredict(logit_mod1, "bill_depth_mm [all]") %>%
  plot()
```


#### model_02


```{r}
library(brms)

brms_mod2 <- brm(
  male ~ 1 + bill_length_mm + bill_depth_mm + flipper_length_mm + body_mass_g + (1 | species),
  data = d,
  family = binomial(link = "logit")
)
```


```{r}
summary(brms_mod2)
```

```{r}
library(ggeffects)
ggpredict(brms_mod2, "bill_depth_mm [all]") %>%
  plot()
```



#### model_03

```{r}
penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = bill_length_mm, color = species)) +
  geom_point()
```



```{r}
library(brms)
brms_mod3 <- brm(bill_length_mm ~ flipper_length_mm + (1 + species),
  data = penguins
)
```


```{r}
penguins %>%
  group_by(species) %>%
  modelr::data_grid(flipper_length_mm) %>%
  tidybayes::add_fitted_draws(brms_mod3, n = 100) %>%
  ggplot() +
  geom_point(
    data = penguins,
    aes(flipper_length_mm, bill_length_mm, color = species, shape = species)
  ) +
  geom_line(aes(flipper_length_mm, .value, group = interaction(.draw, species), color = species), alpha = 0.1)
```

## 机器学习

?predict.model_fit
https://tidymodels.github.io/model-implementation-principles/model-predictions.html


```{r}
library(tidymodels)
split <- penguins %>% 
  mutate(species = as_factor(species)) %>% 
  mutate(species = fct_lump(species, 1)) %>% 
  initial_split()

split

training_data <- training(split)
training_data
testing_data <- testing(split)
testing_data

model <- parsnip::logistic_reg() %>% 
  set_engine("glm") %>% 
  set_mode("classification") %>% 
  fit(species ~ bill_length_mm, data = training_data)


bind_cols(
  predict(model, new_data = testing_data, type = "class"),
  predict(model, new_data = testing_data, type = "prob"),
  testing_data
)


predict(model, new_data = testing_data) %>% 
  bind_cols(testing_data) %>% 
  count(.pred_class, species)
```


```{r}
model_neighbor <- parsnip::nearest_neighbor(neighbors = 10) %>% 
  set_engine("kknn") %>% 
  set_mode("classification") %>% 
  fit(species ~ bill_length_mm, data = training_data)

predict(model_neighbor, new_data = testing_data) %>% 
  bind_cols(testing_data) %>% 
  count(.pred_class, species)
```
